com.yantra.api.omp.receipts

Interface receiveOrder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface receiveOrder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document receiveOrder(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The receiveOrder API records receipt of quantities or receipt of a license plate against an order or a shipment.

    • Method Detail

      • receiveOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document receiveOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                                  org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                           throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                  java.rmi.RemoteException
        The receiveOrder API records receipt of quantities or receipt of a license plate against an order or a shipment. This is represented by the RECEIVE_RECEIPT transaction. The input identifies the shipment, order, or order release being received. If a receipt does not exist for the input, then a receipt is created.

        Intransit shipments cannot be received using receiveOrder API.

        The receiveOrder accepts a wide range of input to attempt identify the receipt, shipment or order. Input can provide the keys that identify a receipt, shipment or order. Alternatively, partial information for an order or shipment can be passed,and the receiveOrder API attempts to find a unique match for that information. If a unique match can be found, the RECEIVE_RECEIPT transaction is processed. If a unique match is not found, an error is returned.

        The above error will be thrown only if the ALLOW_RECEIPT_OF_UNEXPECTED_ITEMS is set to N. If the rule is Y and the specific receipt line is passed, then receipt line will be overridden with the item specified. OVERRIDE_ITEM_ID and OVERRIDE_UOM will be set to the item specified (if they differ). Inventory updates will be based on these overrides. The item on the line will remain as is.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        This API invokes the following user exits:

          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSBeforeReceiveOrderUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetOverriddenOveragePercentageUE
          com.yantra.ycp.japi.ue.YCPDetermineTaskTypeUE.

        Events Raised:
        These events are raised under transaction RECEIVE_RECEIPT.
        ON_SKU_RECEIPT:

          This event is raised upon receiving all the items specified in the input.
          Data published - RECEIVE_RECEIPT.ON_SKU_RECEIPT.xml
          Key data - receipt_dbd.txt

        ON_CASE_RECEIPT:
          This event is raised upon receiving the specified case in the input.
          Data published - RECEIVE_RECEIPT.ON_CASE_RECEIPT.xml
          Key data - receipt_dbd.txt

        ON_PALLET_RECEIPT:
          This event is raised upon receiving the specified pallet in the input.
          Data published - RECEIVE_RECEIPT.ON_PALLET_RECEIPT.xml
          Key data - receipt_dbd.txt

        Note that, only the above three events ON_SKU_RECEIPT, ON_CASE_RECEIPT and ON_PALLET_RECEIPT are used if putaway of receipts has to be initiated automatically.

        ON_SUCCESS:
          This event is raised upon successful execution of this api.
          Data published - RECEIVE_RECEIPT.ON_SUCCESS.xml
          Key data - receipt_dbd.txt
        Following events are raised under transaction INVENTORY_COST_CHANGE.
        INVENTORY_COST_CHANGE:
          At the time of purchase order receipt this event is raised from inventory management module for each receipt line containing details of a single receipt line to generate G/L level postings in a financial application. One event is published for each purchase order line as a receipt is recorded against it. If a purchase order line is received in multiple receipts, multiple events will be raised.
          Data published - YFS_RECEIVE_ORDER.INVENTORY_COST_CHANGE
          Key data - YFS_RECEIVE_ORDER.INVENTORY_COST_CHANGE

        Template Support:
        Yes.
        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility:
        N/A.

        INVENTORY_COST_WRITEOFF:
          When doing a receipt against an item/node that has a negative on-hand balance, Inventory Value and Average Cost calculations need to be modified. This event will publish the delta between recalculated inventory value and the write off amount details.
          Data published - YFS_RECEIVE_ORDER.INVENTORY_COST_WRITEOFF
          Key data - YFS_RECEIVE_ORDER.INVENTORY_COST_WRITEOFF

        Template Support:
        Yes.
        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility:
        N/A.

        INVENTORY_VALUE_CHANGE:
          At the time of return order receipt this event is raised from inventory management module for each return receipt line with the inventory value change information for the return location.
          Data published - YFS_RECEIVE_ORDER.INVENTORY_VALUE_CHANGE
          Key data - YFS_RECEIVE_ORDER.INVENTORY_VALUE_CHANGE

        Template Support:
        No.
        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility:
        N/A.

        Audits: None.

        Pre-conditions: None.

        Post-conditions: None.

        Output Template Support: Yes.

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes.

        Additional Information

          When receipt lines are created:
          • If a unique identifier of a line is not provided, and the receipt line contains the ItemId to be received, multiple shipment or order released lines could be matched. If multiple lines are matched, the receiving quantity is distributed across the matched lines and overage is calculated against the last matched line.
          • The Quantity passed to be received is always considered against the first receivable line. That is, Quantity is considered in terms of UnitOfMeasure of the first receivable line.
          • If the Quantity is distributed across several lines which have different unit of measure, the Quantity is converted to a unit of measure suitable to each line.

          Hints:

          • If attributes of an item (like LotNumber, BatchNo) are required in any one of the receivable line, try receiving that line by uniquely identifying it. This can be done in several ways, or example by providing OrderNo, PrimeLineNo, and SubLineNo. See input xml for more information on the values that can uniquely identify a line.
          • A list of receivable lines can be obtained using getLinesToReceive API.
          • For correct status updates on the order lines the pipeline must be customized appropriately to have different instances of RECEIVE_RECEIPT transaction to pick up different statuses.

          Errors

            OMP10008: Invalid Receipt Line to receive. is thrown in any of below conditions
            • The receipt line being received is unable to identify even a single order line.
            • The node where the order line should be received or returned is either void or different from the receipt's receiving node.
            • The item being received is probably a component of a physical kit item.
            • The Shipment does not allow overage.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains the received information in this receipt. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
